intro: Quararibea bolivarii, commonly known as the Bolivian quina, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Amazon basin. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by woody capsules containing numerous seeds. It is valued for its medicinal properties, particularly for the treatment of fever and inflammation. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
